citations.narrative:
Acquisition and disposition records for dogs and cats are not being made, kept, and maintained on the required APHIS
Form 7005 Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand and the APHIS Form 7006 Record of Disposition of Dogs
and Cats, respectively. Use of these APHIS Forms allow for complete and accurate identification as well as tracking of
animals being used in regulated activities. Each dealer and exhibitor shall utilize APHIS Form 7005 Record of Acquisition
of Dogs and Cats on Hand and APHIS Form 7006 Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats to make, keep, and maintain
acquisition and disposition information or request a variance if using a computerized record keeping system that makes
use of APHIS Forms 7005 and 7006 unsuitable.
Correct by March 7, 2024.

The ground horizontal bar of the wire mesh/chain link fence and gate in the cement yard of the adoption building is no
longer structurally sound. The horizontal bar is rusted with holes and sharp points in the rusted areas. Dogs and puppies
which are allowed play time in this area may injure themselves on the rusted areas. Correct by ensuring the fence and
gate are kept in good repair and protect the animals from injury.
Correct by March 21, 2024.

The cat cottage pressed wood flooring is no longer impervious to moisture. Moisture has seeped through floor seams in
the open space where cats have free roam, causing the underlying grey pressed board to wick moisture and swell up
through the floor seams. One cat enclosure that sits open ended on top of the wood floor has an approximately two-inch
diameter compromised area in which the wood has pulled away and the previous underlying vinyl floor is exposed. Floors
and surfaces that absorb water, urine, and other fluids, cannot be effectively cleaned and sanitized, which can damage
structural integrity and harbor disease. Correct by ensuring the floors and walls of indoor housing facilities, and any other
surfaces in contact with animals are impervious to moisture.
Correct by May 22, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
